frameDefinitions: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.
Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking.
A Perceiver determines the Location of a Sought_entity within a Ground.
An Agent sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a Phenomenon.
An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech,  that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.
frameExamples: Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
Carolyn <t>abandoned</t> her car and jumped on a red double decker bus.
CSTR actively <t>collaborates</t> with the Departments of Artificial Intelligence  and Physics.
Kim <t>found</t> his hat on the far side.
While visiting in Port Alberni, the day before he was diagnosed, we <t>recorded</t> him to have 14 drinks and go to the bathroom 10 times.
I <t>penned</t> a letter concerning racism to Congress.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex> is the person who acts to leave behind the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fex name='Theme'>Theme</fex> is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the <fex name='Agent'>Agent</fex>'s possession.
When the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> gives up the <fen>Theme</fen>.

When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause.
This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically  less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration.
This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the <fen>Partners</fen> are collaborating.
This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Partners</fen> are engaged in their collaboration.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the collaboration occurs.
The individual that determines the <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> succeeds in finding.
The position of the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The general set of entities that the <fen>Perceiver</fen> examined in order to find the <fen>Sought_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Sought_entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient entity that creates a permanent record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Agent</fen> becomes aware.
That feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
The <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen> that is recorded for the specified <fen>Attribute</fen>.
An <fen>Entity</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> records the <fen>Value</fen> of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> creates the record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> sets down the facts.
The <fen>Author</fen> produces a particular <fen>Text</fen>.
The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the text is created.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
<fex>Smithers</fex> collaborated with Chief Wiggum
Britain is collaborating <fex>with France and West Germany</fex> in the development of anti-tank missiles
The two artists collaborated <fex>on a mosaic</fex>.
<fex>Smithers and Chief Wiggum</fex> collaborated well
<fex>Last year</fex> some of my colleagues collaborated in the design of a theme-park.
<fex>In New Braunfels</fex> Paul and John collaborated in the design of a new Guggenheim
<fex>I</fex> finally found the peanut underneath the couch cusion.
I found him <fex>under the bed</fex>.
Sam located the Imperial regal <fex>among the coins in his pocket</fex> and passed it to the boy.
We found it <fex>last night</fex>.
Police informed Mr Wong that <fex>they</fex> recorded the attack as a racial incident.
Adams took some very good advice and meticulously recorded <fex>the events that ensued</fex>.

When Mohammed was sentenced to death in the Anti-Terrorism Court in Rawalpindi
the court recorded <fex>his age</fex> as  17 or 18.

In the fiscal year 2000, Nepal's imports from China and Tibet were recorded <fex>at
166.6 million dollars</fex>.
At the time the Army recorded <fex>him</fex> as a married resident of the Town of Two Creeks.
From what the book says, these events were recorded <fex>in the Chamber of Mazarbul</fex> .
Michael wrote <fex>a frame description</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Article 102 of the Charter of the United Nations

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Article 102 of the Charter of the United Nations
